result.execSummary:
The defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rhonda K. Pfenning

records.addlTxt: Department of Corrections Discharge Certificate - It is ordered that effective September 01, 2020, discharged from said judgment only.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel confirms receipt of PSI.  State notes PSI thorough, recommendation 2-3 yrs. appropriate.  State recommends 2 yrs. initial confinement, 2 yrs. extended supervision with conditions of extended supervision as state in PSI.  Atty Waters can't see how this can be a prison case, she's never been in jail before this case, spent 150 days in jail.  Recommend the court not adopt the recommendation and sentence defendant to probation.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court notes recommendation a fraction of the maximum and with 4 read ins; been on probation 5 times, been in treatment, 2 pending felonies at this time, probation and treatment have not worked so far.  Court calculates 152 days credit, arrested 4/2/15.  Court notes 2 facts learned today, she had 8 yrs of sobriety, never been in jail before and that changes something.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 5 yrs. probation.  Conditions of probation:  6 mos. in the PCJ com. immediately with credit for 152 days served; comply with any assessment or counseling as set up by P&P; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns without advanced written permission of P&P; no other violations of law; no controlled substances; order mental health assessment and comply with treatment recom.; pay costs as set up by P&P but w/in the first 2 yrs. of probation.  Advised of appeal rights; felony prohibitions.
Sentencing hearing at 09-01-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties reached an agreement.  Defendant will plead to Count 3, State will DRI other charges; joint recommendation of PSI and State recom. won't exceed 2 yrs. IC.  State moves to amend Ct 3 in Information to 961.41(1m)(e)2.  Court so amends.  Court advises defendant of the amended count 3/max penalties and rights.  Defendant pleads no contest. Court reviews PLQ/WOR form.  Court finds defendant's waiver of her constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea to count 3 and finds defendant guilty.  All other counts DRI.  Order PSI.
Plea hearing at 07-07-2015 11:30 am

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel confirms receipt of competency report.  Competency report found defendant competent.  Court inquires if defense counsel requests an independent evaluation.  Atty Waters informs the court defendant believes she is competent and he has no grounds to continue to request that; she's more competent now that at the time it was raised.  Court finds defendant competent to proceed.  Atty Waters received an offer but requests more time.  Atty Waters requests bond be modified to surety bond.  State opposes bond modification.  Court explains surety bond vs. cash bond.  Person present in courtroom is not owner of the home.  Court orders bond remain as previously set.  Status conference set for 7/7/15 @ 2:30 p.m.

Attorney Patrick William Waters appeared by phone means. Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond hearing requested by Atty Waters to request a surety bond.  His client informed him T.K. would post his house as satisfaction of the bond.  Her fiance resides with him.  Court inquires the value of the home and if any mortgage or lien against it.  Mr. K. notes value of home at $84,000 with $40,000 mortgage.  Homestead exemption $75,000, no equity in home.  Surety needs to find non-exempt assets.  (Tape #6)
Competency hearing at 06-16-2015 03:30 pm

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters informs the court he was going to ask for modification of bond but don't believe his client is competent to proceeds and ask the court order a competency exam.  Court orders outpatient jail, cancel JT & FTP.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on July 13, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.  Time allowed for trial is two days.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for June 16, 2015 at 1:15 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than June 1, 2015. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than June 1, 2015, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions.
If any party intends to call a rebuttal expert in relation to such expert or testimony that party shall provide the same information as above w/in 15 days of receipt of the notice.  If either side opposes or seeks limitations on such expert testimony, that party shall promptly file a motion to be heard on a date before (but not at) the FPT.
8.  The State and the Defense shall file and serve no later than 5 days before the FPT:
a.  A list ... witnesses.
b.  ....
9 . .... 
10.  Both parties shall be present with their client and ready to go on the record no later than 8:30 on the morning of trial. 
Failure to comply with SCO may subject the attorney and parties to sanctions allowed in 805.03 Wis. Stats., including but not limited to .......

Jury trial at 07-13-2015 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial at 06-16-2015 01:15 pm.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of elements of each count as stated in the Information/max. penalties and constitutional rights.  Atty Waters renews motion to dismiss count 4, nothing noted she was on felony bond.  Court notes motion, informs counsel if wishes a hearing on the motion to schedule it.  Court finds probable cause in counts 1, 2, 3 & 5 clerk to check the PC box.  Defendant stands mute, court enters NGP on her behalf.  Bond remains as previously set.  Counsel referred to scheduling clerk to set FPT/JT.
Arraignment at 04-21-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State requests joint preliminary hearings in 15CF10 & 15CF11.  Counsel for defendants requests separate preliminary hearings.  Court orders preliminary hearings joined.  State calls Investigator Engfer - Sworn & examined.  Cross by counsel.  Closing comments by State. Atty Waters objects to bind over on felony counts and moves to dismiss misdemeanor count.  Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed and binds defendant over.  Atty Waters requests modification of bond to high Sign. Bond.  Court orders bond remain as set.
J. VA. is required to appear on 04/14/2015 at 1:00 pm
L.E. is required to appear on 04/14/2015 at 1:00 pm
Atty Patrick Waters appt'd.
Preliminary hearing at 04-14-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights, right to preliminary hearing, felony conviction prohibitions.  Atty Waters requests bond modification to signature or $300 cash bond for reasons stated.  State objections and requests court maintain $5000 cash bond.  Court maintains bond as set.  Prelim. Hrg. requested within time limits.  Referred to Scheduling Clerk to set P.H. w/in 10 days.

Defendant Rhonda K. Pfenning in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Advised of right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $5000 cash.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
